mdRecord.dcterms:title: Wright Studio-Residence, exterior

Wright, Lloyd (American architect and scenographer, 1890-1978) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: From 1923 through 1926 Frank Lloyd Wright Jr. was drawn into the ambitious attempt to evolve the "textile block" system into a patented construction technique. He designed and built his own home with a ground floor studio and second floor residence, using concrete blocks, in West Hollywood in 1927. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lloyd_Wright [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
dwellings
studios (work spaces)
pierced walls
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: 858 North Doheny Drive, West Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, United States
